summary: The Military Police (MP) are mentioned in the documents primarily in the context of law enforcement and security within the military. Their role involves apprehension of individuals, investigation of potential security threats, and coordination with other law enforcement agencies. The documents highlight their involvement in apprehending deserters, investigating potential counter-intelligence interests, and handling security clearances. The documents do not directly link the Military Police to the JFK assassination, but rather depict their standard operational duties within the military during the specified time periods.
significance: Based on the provided documents, the Military Police do not appear to have any direct significance in the JFK assassination context. Their presence in these documents relates to routine law enforcement and security matters within the military.
